name: Σ-Normal Form Existence Theorem
statement: For any finite contraction plan P that respects the Σ-axioms, there exists a unique Σ-normal form NF\_SIGMA such that no further invariant-restoring Σ-rewrite is applicable.

proof\_sketch\_dual\_column.standard\_side: Show termination via strictly decreasing measure (number of index violations \+ polarity violations \+ null-mode violations) and local confluence of Σ-rewrites.
proof\_sketch\_dual\_column.igsoa\_side: Define a Box-level measure μ\_SIGMA over contraction plans. Each rewrite strictly decreases μ\_SIGMA, and overlap critical-pairs resolve via Θ-aware Σ rules, yielding unique NF\_SIGMA.
